page.title: 14THE WESLEYAN CHAPEL
page.content:
The Chapel is a small brick{building} at the northern end of Souldrop high street. It was built in 1912 to replace the sheet steel hut that previously stood on the site. (The original Chapel was a temporary building constructed in 1838 on a different site.)
{Services}take place on Sundays at 2.45pm and are usually taken by the Rev. Taplin from Rushden. Some of the{congregation}come from outside the village -there being only two methodist families in the village now.
The Chapel features a locally carved stone{font}and a{pulpit}engraved "God is Love - Rock of Ages"
